children.categoryDescription: Configure the Accounts payload to enable or disable guest accounts.

Configure the Calendar payload to provide account settings for connecting to a CalDAV-compliant calendar server. As with Exchange accounts, users need to manually enter information you omit from the profile, such as their account password, when the profile is installed.

Configure the Contacts payload to provide account settings for connecting to a CardDAV-compliant contact server. If you omit the account information, users need to enter it manually when the profile is installed.
Use the LDAP payload to enter settings to enable corporate directory services for users such as connecting to an LDAPv3 directory.
Use the Mobile Account payload to configure mobile account creation and related settings on devices.

categoryDescription: Configure the AirPlay payload to define AirPlay settings on devices, such as preconfiguring passwords for AirPlay Mirroring destinations and to listing allowed destinations for devices.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the App Lock payload to specify a single app that can be used on a device. This payload forces the selected app to open on the device and prevents the use of other apps. Additional apps appear in this list if theyve been added using in the Restrictions payload. When this payload is active, the app reopens immediately after a device is restarted. Apps can also be updated while using App Lock.
Configure the Associated Domains payload to manage domains with features such as Extensible App SSO, universal links, and Password Auto Fill for devices.

children.description: App Management > Autonomous Single App Mode
children.categoryDescription: Configure the ASAM payload to set an app to control devices. Installing this payload on a device grants low-level access to the system for the specified app - which includes, but is not limited to, installing systemwide monitoring capabilities.
Use the NS Extension Management payload to control which extensions can be used on a device.

categoryDescription: Use the App Store payload to configure macOS App Store restrictions on devices.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Directory Service payload to add directory servers and settings to devices.
Configure an app extension that enables single sign-on (SSO) for devices.

children.description: Authentication > Extensible Single Sign On Kerberos
children.categoryDescription: The Kerberos Extensible SSO uses Apple's built-in Kerberos extension. This option is a Kerberos-specific version of the Credential app extension.
Configure the Identification payload to save names of the account user and prompt text on devices. If the username is left blank, users must provide this information when installing the profile.

categoryDescription: These settings configure the declarations used by Apples declarative device management feature. These settings are separate from older MDM settings and only apply to a device enabled for declarative management. Learn more about declarative management at developer.apple.com

Declarative Device Management preview Custom Profile

children.categoryDescription: If you're configuring corporate-owned work profile devices, some of these settings will only take effect at the work profile-level. This is marked in the setting name. For all other devices, these settings will take effect at the device-level.

If you're configuring corporate-owned work profile devices, some of these settings will only take effect at the work profile-level. This is marked in the setting name. For all other devices, these settings will take effect at the device-level.
These settings work for corporate-owned work profile devices.

If you're configuring corporate-owned work profile devices, some of these settings will only take effect at the work profile-level. This is marked in the setting name. For all other devices, these settings will take effect at the device-level.

If you're configuring corporate-owned work profile devices, some of these settings will only take effect at the work profile-level. This is marked in the setting name. For all other devices, these settings will take effect at the device-level.

categoryDescription: The Firewall configuration service provider configures the Windows Defender Firewall global settings, per profile settings, as well as the desired set of custom rules to be enforced on the device. Using the Firewall CSP the IT admin can now manage non-domain devices, and reduce the risk of network security threats across all systems connecting to the corporate network.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the FileVault payload to manage FileVault disk encryption settings on devices.

Configure the FileVault Recovery Key Escrow payload to customize FileVault Recovery Key Escrow settings on devices.

description: Local user group membership policies help to add, remove, or replace members of local groups on Windows devices.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Login Items payload to specify the apps, files, folders, and network mounts that are opened when users log in.

Configure the Login Window Behavior payload to set preferences for user login, control the users ability to restart and shut down devices from the login window, and set the appearance of the login window.
Configure the Login Window Behavior payload to specify the apps, files, folders, and network mounts that are opened when users log in.

children.description: Login > Service Management - Managed Login Items
children.categoryDescription: Configure the Service Management  Managed Login Items payload to manage the background tasks and items that are opened when users log in.

categoryDescription: The managed settings allows the server to set settings on the device. These settings take effect on a one-time basis. The user may still be able to change the settings at a later time.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Bluetooth command to enable or disable Bluetooth on devices. Users will still be able to modify Bluetooth on their device even if configured by this command. It is recommended to set the Allow Bluetooth Modification in Restrictions to False to prevent users from modifying the Bluetooth value that is configured by this command.

description: Media Management > Media Management Disc Burning
categoryDescription: Configure the Media Management Disc Burning payload to control disc-burning settings on devices.

categoryDescription: Configure the Microsoft AutoUpdate preferences to control the update process for Microsoft applications on devices.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Antivirus engine settings to manage the preferences of the antivirus component of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.
Configure the Cloud-delivered protection preference settings to manage the cloud-driven protection features of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

children.description: Microsoft Defender > Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) preferences
children.categoryDescription: Configure the Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) preference settings to manage the EDR component of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.
Configure the User interface preference settings to manage how users can interact with the Microsoft Defender for Endpoint user interface.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Cellular payload to manage a devices APN and mobile network proxy settings, which define how the device connects to the carriers network. Change these settings only if instructed to do so by a carrier network expert. If these settings are incorrect, the device cant access data using the mobile network. To undo a change to these settings, remove the profile from the device.

Configure the Content Caching payload to configure devices to save a local copy of content, making it easier to be retrieved by other Apple devices without connecting to the Internet. This caching accelerates downloads by saving software updates, apps, photos, and other content the first time they're downloaded. Since apps are downloaded once and shared to other devices, schools and organizations with many devices save bandwidth.
Configure the DNS Settings payload to control DNS settings for on devices, such as specifying apps that must use specific DNS settings.
Configure the Domains payload to specify marked domains, which mail domains are marked in Mail on the device, and which web domains documents are considered managed in iOS and iPadOS.
Configure the Firewall payload to turn on the Firewall in macOS to prevent unwanted connections from the internet or other networks.

Configure the Network Usage Rules payload to specify how managed apps use mobile data. Managed apps can be restricted on mobile and roaming networks. This forces the app to communicate only through Wi-Fi networks.

children.description: Parental Controls > Parental Controls Application Restrictions
children.categoryDescription: Configure the Parental Controls Application Restrictions payload to restrict applications on macOS devices.

children.description: Parental Controls > Parental Controls Content Filter
children.categoryDescription: Configure the Parental Controls Content Filter payload to control access to content on macOS devices.
Configure the Parental Controls Dictionary payload to control dictionary and dictation content on macOS devices.

children.description: Parental Controls > Parental Controls Game Center
children.categoryDescription: Configure the Parental Controls Game Center payload to control GameKit feature account modification.

children.description: Parental Controls > Parental Controls Time Limits
children.categoryDescription: Configure the Parental Controls Time Limits payload to limit the amount of daily device use and restrict the hours when the device can be used.
Configure the Global Preferences payload to manage global settings on devices such as multiple sessions and auto logout delay.
Configure the System Preferences payload to manage the panes in the System Preferences user interface on devices.
Configure the User Preferences payload to manage iCloud password preferences for local accounts on devices.
AirPrint is an Apple feature that is built into most printer models and allows devices to print files over a wireless network. Use these settings to add AirPrint information to devices.
Configure the Printing payload to manage printer settings for devices, such as specifying which printers are configured for use and applying a footer.
Configure the Privacy Preferences Policy Control payload to manage the settings in the Privacy pane of Security & Privacy preferences on devices.

categoryDescription: Elevation Rules set the conditions for allowing users to get just-in-time access to apps and files on their devices.

Configure the Profile Removal Password payload to provide a password to allow users to remove a locked configuration profile from the device. If this payload is present and has a password value set, the device asks for the password when the user taps a profile's Remove button. Profiles are only able to be removed if configured as removable. This payload is encrypted with the rest of the profile.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Global HTTP Proxy payload to specify a proxy for all HTTP traffic to and from enrolled devices. If you choose Manual proxy type you need the proxy server address  including its port and, optionally, a username and password for logging in to the proxy server. If you choose Auto proxy type, you can enter a proxy auto-configuration (PAC) URL.
Configure the Network Proxy Configuration settings to permit the device to use a proxy server for access to websites.

categoryDescription: Configure the Restrictions payload to enable or disable features on devices. These configurations can be used prevent users from accessing a specific app, service or function on enrolled devices. For example, a restriction can be added that prevents an iPhone or iPad from using AirPrint. Another restriction can be added to prevent the sharing of passwords over AirDrop on an iPhone, iPad and Mac. Certain restrictions on an iPhone may be mirrored on a paired Apple Watch.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Passcode payload to specify whether a password or passcode is required to access and use an enrolled device. When the configuration profile is installed, users are asked to enter a password or passcode that meets the policies you specify. Otherwise, the profile wont be installed. When the Passcode payload is installed on an iPhone or iPad, users have 60 minutes to enter a passcode. If users dont do so within that time frame, the payload forces them to enter a passcode using the specified settings. If you use device policies and Exchange passcode policies, the two sets of policies are merged and the strictest settings are enforced.
Configure the Security Preferences payload to set various security options on devices.
Configure the Smart Card payload to manage specific settings for Smart Cards on enrolled devices. User overrides arent permitted.

categoryDescription: Configure the Software Update payload to control whether macOS devices check for and install updates automatically, can install prerelease software, and more. These settings also let you set client options and prevent end users from making changes to configured settings.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Energy Saver payload to configure power-related settings for enrolled devices. Some hardware-specific options must be set manually on the device and arent available through a configuration profile.
Configure the File Provider payload to control which file providers can be used on an enrolled device.
The Lock Screen Message settings can be used to configure content displayed on the login window and lock screen.
Configure the Screensaver payload to manage screensaver settings on enrolled devices.

Configure the System Extensions payload settings for enrolled devices. Installing or removing this payload can change the state of system extensions on the Mac. If a containing app activates a system extension, and the system extension is in a pending state, installing a payload that allows the extension completes the activation process. If a system extension is active, removing a payload that allows the extension deactivates that extension.
Configure the System Logging payload to manage private data logging on devices.
Configure the Time Server payload to manage time server settings for devices.
Configure the System Policy Managed payload to configure the Finder's contextual menu to bypass the system policy.
Configure the Accessibility payload to define specific settings for users who have difficulty with vision, hearing, or physical mobility.
Configure the Desktop payload to configure the desktop on devices.
Configure the Dock payload to configure the dock on devices.
Configure the Finder payload to control Finder preference settings and specify which commands can be used on devices.
Configure the Managed Menu Extras payload to control the menu extras on devices.
Configure the Notification payload to manage notifications for specific applications, such as blocking notification previews or controlling how notifications appear when devices are unlocked.
Configure the Screensaver User payload to manage a users screensaver settings on devices.
Configure the Time Machine payload to define the location and options for Time Machine backups on managed devices.

categoryDescription: Configure the Web Content Filter payload configure devices to use Apples built-in filter or connect and authenticate to a 3rd party content filter provider service. You can create a list of allowed web links and restricted web links. For example, you can allow only contoso web sites to open.

children.categoryDescription: Configure the Xsan payload to configure an Xsan client system.
Configure the Xsan Preferences payload to configure which volumes automatically mount at startup.
